alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued June 13 at 3:23AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected for elevations above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulation of between 4 and 8 inches at mountain pass level, and over 20 inches on ridge tops. Winds will gust up to 70 mph at times. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, especially over Marias Pass, due to heavy wet snow accumulation on the road and strong winds. Strong winds could cause damage to snow-loaded trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The NWS recommends that those recreating in the back country, who are not prepared for winter conditions, should move to lower elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
